intro: Cremaspora bocandeana, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking, bright orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elongated, narrow leaves and produces small, winged fruits that disperse its seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in warmer climates. Its rapid growth and vibrant floral display make it a notable botanical feature in its native habitat.
